title: Environmental motion measurement tutorial
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to measure ambient motion using your device's camera.

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Moves the following components to the workspace

the **intensity** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/environmentalmotion/intensity.png)

and the **event** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/environmentalmotion/event.png)

the event component will help the program to know when there is a change in the intensity of measured motion

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/Logic.png) on the sidebar,

move the **if** component to the workspace

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/if-component.png)

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/Math.png) on the sidebar,

move the **number** component to the workspace

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/number-component.png)

and put the components as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/environmentalmotion/image.png)
the idea is that every time there is a change in the measured motion intensity, it is evaluated if this is greater than a certain number, and if this is the case, the measured intensity is displayed on the console.
